attributes.action: If a petition reaches 100,000. All mp's must attend parliament to debate it
attributes.additional_details: It is not enough just to recall parliament if a petition reaches 100,000 votes while the mp's are on their summer holiday ( as a currently running petition proposes). As this would not necessarily guarantee that all mp's attend
attributes.background: How can what we live in be considered a democracy, if only a handful of mp's turn up to debate an issue that a large proportion of voters feel strongly about . While the rest of the mp's consider it of too little importance to turn up .If it concerned their wages or pension they would all turn up.
